intro: Erigeron trigonus, commonly known as the three-lobed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale blue flowers. Erigeron trigonus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ecological value and ornamental appeal.
